metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34918 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.18.9. A typeconfusion bug in nft_set_elem_init (leading to a buffer overflow) could beused by a local attacker to escalate privileges, a different vulnerabilitythan CVE-2022-32250. (The attacker can obtain root access, but must startwith an unprivileged user namespace to obtain CAP_NET_ADMIN access.) Thiscan be fixed in nft_setelem_parse_data in net/netfilter/nf_tables_api.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required
